de.heidelberg.cl.ap.ss13.helper

Class Preparation

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.heidelberg.cl.ap.ss13.helper.Preparation

  • public class Preparation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that handles various preparation steps that are necessary before the MapReduce job can be performed
    Author:
    Carolin Haas (carhaas1@gmail.com)

      • Initalisation

        public static void Initalisation(java.lang.String source_file,
                 java.lang.String target_file,
                 java.lang.String output_file,
                 boolean insert_null_token,
                 java.lang.String trans_table_file,
                 java.lang.String alignment_prob_file,
                 java.lang.String ini_state_prob_file,
                 boolean log_prob,
                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> hash_table_source,
                 java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> hash_table_target)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        Combines the two parallel text files sentence-wise. First the source sentences, then the distinctive separator " ||| " and then the target sentence. This is necessary so that the Map function receives both languages through its usual input Then it initializes the translation table, the alignment transition probability and the initial state probability uniformly
        Parameters:
        source_file - the input file location of the source language text
        target_file - the input file location of the target language text
        output_file - the output file location of the combined text
        insert_null_token - whether or not to insert a null token
        trans_table_file - the output file location for the translation table
        alignment_prob_file - the output file location for the alignment transition probability
        ini_state_prob_file - the output file location for the initial state probability
        log_prob - whether or not log probability should be used for initialization
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
